page.title: 20VISIT WILLINGTON
page.content: VISIT WILLINGTON IF YOU COME TO VISIT YOU CAN BUY FOOD AT THE SHOP OR GO TO "THE CROWN".IT IS IN STATION ROAD BECAUSE WE USED TO HAVE A RAILWAY.TURN RIGHT AT THE BOTTOM AND YOU GO ALONG CHAPEL LANE. THE CHAPEL WAS MOVED THERE FROM CROOTS FARM ON ROLLERS IN 1867 AND THEN BRICKED ROUND.YOU CAN GO ON TO MOWSBURY PLACE AND A PATH TAKES YOU TO THE LOCK AND WEIR.IF YOU HAD TURNED LEFT ALONG CHURCH ROAD YOU WOULD GO PAST THE SCHOOL .ONE OF THE HOUSES WAS A DOVECOTE BUT JOHN GOSTWICK HAD A BIG ONE BUILT TO KEEP 1500 DOVES IN WHEN HENRY VIII CAME TO VISIT WILLINGTON IN 1541. IF YOU BRING YOUR CHILDREN THEY CAN PLAY ON THE SWINGS AND SLIDE.ALL THE ROADS ARE NAMED AFTER FAMOUS PEOPLE WHO LIVED HERE.IT IS PEACEFUL.
